brief: Create an interactive health insurance plan comparison tool for users.
business_problem: Consumers struggle to understand complex health insurance options, leading to poor choices. This confusion results in inadequate coverage and financial strain during medical emergencies.
target_users: Individuals seeking health insurance plans for themselves or their families
goals: Develop an intuitive comparison interface for multiple insurance plans
Animate transitions for better user engagement and understanding
Implement tooltips to explain key insurance terms and features
deliverables: Interactive health insurance comparison web app
User guide for navigating the tool
Documentation on code structure and design decisions
assessment_criteria: User engagement metrics, code maintainability, and alignment with user needs

user_stories.title: Compare multiple insurance plans
user_stories.description: As a user, I want to compare different insurance plans side by side to make informed decisions.
acceptance_criteria: Given I am on the comparison page, I can select multiple plans to compare.
The comparison displays key features and costs clearly for each plan.
I can easily remove plans from the comparison view at any time.

user_stories.title: View animated transitions
user_stories.description: As a user, I want smooth animations when switching between plans to enhance my experience.
acceptance_criteria: Given I select a new plan, the transition should animate smoothly within one second.
Animations should not hinder the loading of new information.
I can toggle animations on or off in the settings.

user_stories.title: Access tooltips for insurance terms
user_stories.description: As a user, I want tooltips to explain insurance terms so I can understand my options better.
acceptance_criteria: Given I hover over any term, a tooltip appears with a clear definition.
Tooltips should not obstruct other content on the page.
I can access a glossary of terms from the main menu.
